comments.body: Ordering here matters, so we should probably document it. I suppose it would be sufficient to say that registered plugins are allowed to override tags in the base context provider (but that the order between registered plugins is non-deterministic).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +147,151 @@    information about the context of an MLflow experiment run. Implementations declared though the
    entrypoints `mlflow.run_context_provider` group can be automatically registered through the
    `register_entrypoints` method.

    Registered run context providers can return tags that override those implemented in the core

comments.body: I would document that this iterates through all registered context providers, and allows the provided `tags` to override any set there.
